root.text:
Porsche Boxster

It was a mighty long day when the Boxster keys had to be turned in, as it's been a long time since such a large amount of fun has graced our fleet. The Boxster's deceptively fast, and seems to be so without attracting the attention of the local boys in blue, because we've hardly spent any time discussing it with them.

It's been reliable as well, at least until about 22,000 miles, when it went into the dealership for a normal service and because of a droning, buzzing noise from the rear. We had the folks at Manhattan Motorcars replace a rear wheel bearing and, for good measure, the worn tires with a set of Bridgestone SO2s. Of course, wheel bearings on Boxsters never wear out, so the part had to be ordered, and it took five days to get us on the road. At least the Boxter's warranty covered the bearing replacement. The bonus in all this was that the Bridgestones are terrific, and quiet, too.  

Test Summary: Porsche Boxster

Report number: 4

Total miles driven: 27,795

Miles driven since last report: 4435

Average fuel economy: 21.2 mpg

Worst observed fuel economy: 19.4 mpg

Best observed fuel economy: 24.1 mpg

Maintenance/repair costs: Replace wheel bearing, under warranty

Mike Allen

Popular Mechanics

March 1, 1999
